feed.title: Current Watches, Warnings and Advisories for the United States Issued by the National Weather Service

entry.title: Wind Chill Advisory issued February 10 at 11:59AM AKST until February 12 at 12:00PM AKST by NWS
entry.summary: ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM MIDNIGHT TONIGHT TO NOON AKST SATURDAY... * WHAT...Very cold wind chills expected. The cold wind chills will cause frostbite in as little as 10 minutes to exposed skin. Expect wind chills to range from 40 below zero to 50 below zero.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Eastern Norton Sound and Nulato Hills

entry.title: Wind Chill Warning issued February 10 at 11:58AM AKST until February 11 at 6:00AM AKST by NWS

entry.title: Beach Hazards Statement issued February 10 at 5:01AM PST until February 10 at 7:00PM PST by NWS
entry.summary: ...LONG PERIOD NORTHWEST SWELL WILL BRING RISK OF SNEAKER WAVES TO BEACHES EARLY THURSDAY MORNING THROUGH THURSDAY EVENING... .A long period northwest swell with period 16 to 18 seconds is impacting the coastal waters. This enhanced wave energy will increase the risk of sneaker waves and rip currents. With warm weather in the forecast, beachgoers need to be aware of these
entry.cap:areaDesc: Coastal North Bay Including Point Reyes National Seashore; Northern Monterey Bay; San Francisco; San Francisco Peninsula Coast; Southern Monterey Bay and Big Sur Coast

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued February 10 at 2:09PM EST by NWS
entry.summary: ...INCREASED FIRE DANGER UNTIL 7 PM EST THIS EVENING... A dry airmass will linger across the Upstate of South Carolina and northeast Georgia today. entry.title: Fire Weather Watch issued February 10 at 2:34PM CST until February 11 at 6:00PM CST by NWS
entry.summary: ...Critical Fire Weather Conditions Possible Friday Afternoon... .Strong northwest winds behind a cold front combined with a dry airmass could promote critical fire weather conditions across parts of the local area Friday afternoon. The most prone areas will be along and south of a line extending from Arapahoe Nebraska to Beloit Kansas.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued February 10 at 4:07PM EST by NWS
entry.summary: ...RAIN SHOWERS MAY END AS LOCALLY HEAVY SNOW SHOWERS LATE THIS AFTERNOON AND EARLY THIS EVENING... Rain showers may end as locally heavy snow showers late this afternoon and early this evening. This may make for slick conditions in some areas around the time of rush hour. A strong cold front is expected to move across the region.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Central Interior Cumberland; Coastal Cumberland; Coastal York; Interior York

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued February 10 at 3:21PM EST by NWS
entry.summary: ...SCATTERED RAIN SHOWERS MAY QUICKLY CHANGE TO SNOW SHOWERS LATE THIS AFTERNOON... Rain showers may briefly change to snow showers before ending late this afternoon and early this evening. Some of the snow showers may be briefly heavy. Warm roads from today may become icy early this evening.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued February 10 at 3:56PM EST by NWS
entry.summary: ...Quick Burst of Heavy Snow Expected Overnight... A band of briefly heavy snow will track east across the area after midnight, producing snowfall rates of up to one inch per hour and visibilities as low as a quarter mile. The heavy snow is expected to last only a few hours at any location, with most places receiving 1 to 3 inches of total snow. Wet snow is expected to change to light
entry.cap:areaDesc: Allegan; Barry; Calhoun; Clare; Clinton; Eaton; Gratiot; Ingham; Ionia; Isabella; Jackson; Kalamazoo; Kent; Lake; Mason; Mecosta; Montcalm; Muskegon; Newaygo; Oceana; Osceola; Ottawa; Van Buren

entry.summary: ...Critical Fire Weather Conditions Possible Friday Afternoon... .Strong northwest winds behind a cold front combined with a dry airmass could promote critical fire weather conditions across parts of the local area Friday afternoon. entry.summary: ...RAIN SHOWERS MAY END AS LOCALLY HEAVY SNOW SHOWERS LATE THIS AFTERNOON AND EARLY THIS EVENING... A strong cold front is expected to move across the region.

entry.title: Winter Weather Advisory issued February 10 at 1:11PM CST until February 11 at 4:00AM CST by NWS
entry.summary: ...Period of Snow This Evening With Slick Travel... Snow moves in later this afternoon into the early evening. Bulk accumulations will occur this evening with 2-4" possible from snowfall rates of 1/2 to 1" per hour. In the wake of the storm, patchy freezing drizzle could linger into the early morning hours. If traveling tonight, be prepared for wintry driving conditions.

entry.summary: ...Snow showers late tonight and Friday... This is a special weather statement from the National Weather Service Office in Riverton. * WHAT...Snow showers.
